intro: Corallocarpus poissonii, commonly known as the Poisson's corallocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits are small, round berries that mature to a red color, attracting various bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
